conclusion: Re-interpreting the diagram and problem statement: The triangle is an equilateral triangle.
The problem says 'From the moment when point D reaches the boundary until point C enters the magnetic field'.
This means the triangle is moving to the right. D enters first. Then the side DE starts entering. Then the side CE starts entering.
The statement 'CD is always perpendicular to MN' is the key. MN is a vertical line. If CD is perpendicular to MN, then CD must be a horizontal line. This matches the diagram.
The maximum value of L_inst is a√3/2.
Therefore, the maximum induced electromotive force is EMF_max = B (L_inst, max) v.
